objects.name: Links to other nice yoga websites

references.body_html: Hey guys. I’m looking forward to working with you all again. I’m also pleased to be working with my friend and yoga instructor Marco Fizzulo. This should be straightforward project and I can’t wait to see what we put together.
references.body: Hey guys. I’m looking forward to working with you all again. I’m also pleased to be working with my friend and yoga instructor Marco Fizzulo. This should be straightforward project and I can’t wait to see what we put together.

references.body_html: Hey guys. Glad to be helping out on this site. I LOVE Earthworks! Working on color palettes and font ideas now.
references.body: Hey guys. Glad to be helping out on this site. I LOVE Earthworks! Working on color palettes and font ideas now.

references.body_html: Glad we have the ball rolling, @frank! Looking forward to seeing the site.
references.body: Glad we have the ball rolling, @frank! Looking forward to seeing the site.

references.body_html: I know you guys specialize in your own things, but also know that you all have great design eyes! So I thought I’d ask—are there any sites that you’d recommend for design inspiration? Thanks.
references.body: I know you guys specialize in your own things, but also know that you all have great design eyes! So I thought I’d ask—are there any sites that you’d recommend for design inspiration? Thanks.

references.body_html: I like Design Observer and Dexigner.
references.body: I like [Design Observer](http://www.designobserver.com/) and [Dexigner](http://www.dexigner.com/).

references.body_html: Those are good ones, @marco. I look at Smashing Magazine’s blog a lot and for fonts, I like one called I Love Typography
references.body: Those are good ones, @marco. I look at [Smashing Magazine’s blog](http://www.smashingmagazine.com/) a lot and for fonts, I like one called [I Love Typography](http://ilovetypography.com/)

references.body_html:
I was checking out some other yoga websites and found some nice ones. Here’s a couple:
Oaklandish Yoga: http://bit.ly/8ITnDi
Bikram SF: http://bit.ly/7WAhJj
references.body:
I was checking out some other yoga websites and found some nice ones. Here’s a couple:
Oaklandish Yoga: http://bit.ly/8ITnDi
Bikram SF: http://bit.ly/7WAhJj

references.body_html: I found a yoga website that I really love. It’s a dumb name for a studio, but the website design is flawless: Let’s Get Bent: http://bit.ly/8p0gmf
references.body: I found a yoga website that I really love. It’s a dumb name for a studio, but the website design is flawless: Let’s Get Bent: http://bit.ly/8p0gmf

references.body_html: I think it would be fun AND productive if we could all meet for lunch one day a week. Can we all throw out a couple days/times that might work best? I know you’re all really busy and chances are we won’t all make if every week, but it would be great to at least have a slot on the calendar. Sure, we’re all busy, but we GOTTA EAT, right? Hope we can figure something out. As far as my schedule goes, I’m really flexible. Any day/time works for me.
references.body: I think it would be fun AND productive if we could all meet for lunch one day a week. Can we all throw out a couple days/times that might work best? I know you’re all really busy and chances are we won’t all make if every week, but it would be great to at least have a slot on the calendar. Sure, we’re all busy, but we GOTTA EAT, right? Hope we can figure something out. As far as my schedule goes, I’m really flexible. Any day/time works for me.

references.body_html: Thursdays are good for me!
references.body: Thursdays are good for me!

references.body_html: If Thursday works for Tomas, I think that will work. Tomas?
references.body: If Thursday works for Tomas, I think that will work. Tomas?

references.body_html:
Have you guys read this:
http://sethgodin.typepad.com/seths_blog/2009/12/what-matters-now-get-the-free...
I highly recommend. Please let me know what you think.
references.body:
Have you guys read this:
http://sethgodin.typepad.com/seths_blog/2009/12/what-matters-now-get-the-free-ebook.html
I highly recommend. Please let me know what you think.

references.body_html: Glad you all enjoyed What Matters Now! Godin is awesome. Please consider reading “The Big Red Fez: How To Make Any Web Site Better”. I’d be happy to buy you all a copy; just send me your receipt and I’ll reimburse you. Here’s the Amazon link: http://bit.ly/7tVT1x
references.body: Glad you all enjoyed What Matters Now! Godin is awesome. Please consider reading “The Big Red Fez: How To Make Any Web Site Better”. I’d be happy to buy you all a copy; just send me your receipt and I’ll reimburse you. Here’s the Amazon link: http://bit.ly/7tVT1x

references.body_html: Thanks, Frank. I’ve read a couple of Godin’s other books, but I guess I missed The Big Red Fez. Looking forward to checking it out asap. And thanks for the MacLeod link, Corrina. Funny guy!
references.body: Thanks, Frank. I’ve read a couple of Godin’s other books, but I guess I missed The Big Red Fez. Looking forward to checking it out asap. And thanks for the MacLeod link, Corrina. Funny guy!

references.body_html: I found a yoga website that I really love. It’s a dumb name for a studio, but the website design is flawless: Let’s Get Bent: http://bit.ly/8p0gmf
references.body: I found a yoga website that I really love. It’s a dumb name for a studio, but the website design is flawless: Let’s Get Bent: http://bit.ly/8p0gmf

references.body_html: Of course, Marco! You’re part of the team!!
references.body: Of course, Marco! You’re part of the team!!

references.body_html: Is the client allowed to answer?
references.body: Is the client allowed to answer?

references.name: Links to other nice yoga websites

references.body_html: I can do Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. Any time works. Thanks.
references.body: I can do Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. Any time works. Thanks.

references.body_html:
I was happy to see that Karen Armstrong was invited to contribute to Godin’s collection. After I saw Armstrong on a http://ted.com video recently talking about her work, I read A History of God, her 1993 book. Broad subject, but a great read that I’d recommend:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_History_of_God
references.body:
I was happy to see that Karen Armstrong was invited to contribute to Godin’s collection. After I saw Armstrong on a http://ted.com video recently talking about her work, I read A History of God, her 1993 book. Broad subject, but a great read that I’d recommend:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_History_of_God

references.body_html: I loved What Matters Now. Thanks for the link. I appreciate how the “chapters” were bite-size morsels. Perfect for my A.D.D. ass! LOL. I’m a big proponent of the “less-is-more” maxim, which is why I particularly enjoyed Merlin Mann’s essay about over-doing it.
references.body: I loved What Matters Now. Thanks for the link. I appreciate how the “chapters” were bite-size morsels. Perfect for my A.D.D. ass! LOL. I’m a big proponent of the “less-is-more” maxim, which is why I particularly enjoyed Merlin Mann’s essay about over-doing it.

references.body_html:
Thanks for sending, Frank. That’s an impressive roster Godin put together! I especially liked the graphical stuff like cartoonist Hugh MacLeod’s Ignore Everybody. If you guys don’t know MacLeod’s blog, it’s worth checking out:
Gaping Void: http://gapingvoid.com
references.body:
Thanks for sending, Frank. That’s an impressive roster Godin put together! I especially liked the graphical stuff like cartoonist Hugh MacLeod’s *Ignore Everybody*. If you guys don’t know MacLeod’s blog, it’s worth checking out:
Gaping Void: http://gapingvoid.com
